text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm sharang a technical account
manager here at the AWS office in
Seattle
today I am going to show you how to
associate your SSL or DLS certificate
for multiple domains with your Amazon
cloudfront distribution
let's get started
before we begin note that you cannot
associate more than one SSL or TLS
certificate to an individual cloudfront
distribution
however certificates provided by AWS
certificate manager support up to 10
subject alternative names including
wildcards to turn on SSL or https for
multiple domains served through one
Cloud front distribution assign a
certificate from ACM that includes all
the required domains
now let's see how we can do this using
the AWS Management console
please note you must have the ACM
certificate in the U.S east one region
to attach it to the cloudfront
distribution
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the ACM console page
and then choose the request or
certificate button
here you can see two options request a
public certificate and request a private
certificate for this use case select the
request a public certificate option and
then choose next
under the domain names field enter your
fully qualified domain name to add
another domain name
choose add another name to this
certificate
you have two options for the domain
validation method DNS validation and
email validation if you use email
validation method the email is sent to
the domain owner's email address you can
choose DNS validation if you have access
to the DNS configuration for the domains
covered by your certificate
for this demo I'll choose the DNS
validation method for the key algorithm
select an encryption algorithm depending
on your required cryptographic strength
RSA is the default key algorithm for ACM
certificates and we will keep this for
this demo
to use your own SSL TLS certificate with
multiple domains with a cloudfront
distribution you must import your
certificate into ACM or the AWS identity
and access management certificate store
for more information on importing the
SSL or TLS certificate please open the
link in the video description
now that the certificate is issued I'll
go ahead and navigate to the cloudfront
console
choose the distribution that you want to
associate the ACM certificate to
2. under the general tab choose edit
under custom SSL certificate drop down
list select the ACM certificate that we
created
scroll down and choose save changes
and now you know how to associate your
SSL or TLS certificate for multiple
domains with your Cloud front
distribution
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
